segments.content: It's been a fairly quiet week compared with the previous one, and I couldn't pick any headliner!
segments.sourceMdx: It's been a fairly quiet week compared with the previous one, and I couldn't pick any headliner!

segments.content: The most important news for our ecosystem is probably the official deprecation of Create React App. There's also Tailwind v4 and Standard Schema v1.
segments.sourceMdx: The most important news for our ecosystem is probably the official deprecation of Create React App. There's also Tailwind v4 and Standard Schema v1.

segments.content: I'm quite excited by the upcoming TypeScript 5.8 `erasableSyntaxOnly` flag that forbids usage of features such as enums. This is the path toward making your app compatible Node.js built-in support, and maybe browsers too in the future.
segments.sourceMdx: I'm quite excited by the upcoming TypeScript 5.8 `erasableSyntaxOnly` flag that forbids usage of features such as enums. This is the path toward making your app compatible Node.js built-in support, and maybe browsers too in the future.

segments.content: Convex is the all-in-one platform that gives you everything you need to build, launch, and scale a production-ready backend.
segments.sourceMdx: Convex is the all-in-one platform that gives you everything you need to build, launch, and scale a production-ready backend.

segments.content: Leverage TypeScript to write [queries as code](https://docs.convex.dev/functions/query-functions/) that are automatically cached and realtime, with an acid-compliantÂ [reactive database](https://docs.convex.dev/database).
segments.sourceMdx: Leverage TypeScript to write [queries as code](https://docs.convex.dev/functions/query-functions/) that are automatically cached and realtime, with an acid-compliantÂ [reactive database](https://docs.convex.dev/database).

segments.content: And thatâ€™s just the beginning. With Convex, you can:
segments.sourceMdx: And thatâ€™s just the beginning. With Convex, you can:

segments.content:
* Easily schedule functions and write cron jobs
* Set up file storage
* Write efficient server functions
* Generate your backend with your favorite AI coding tool
* And so much moreâ€¦
segments.sourceMdx:
- Easily schedule functions and write cron jobs
- Set up file storage
- Write efficient server functions

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [Clerk - Build session-based authentication with React and Express](https://go.clerk.com/HRqsMAP)
* ğŸ“£ [Vercel acquires Tremor to invest in open source React components](https://vercel.com/blog/vercel-acquires-tremor): The premium library to build dashboards is now free and open source.
* ğŸ‘€ [CRA breaks with React 19, and CRA needs deprecation notices](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/issues/17004): After various community discussions, Create-React-App has been officially deprecated!
* ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR - New standalone `experimental.useCache` flag for usage without `dynamicIO`](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/75240)
* ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR - New `experimental.slowModuleDetection` flag to report modules that takes a long time to compile](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/75368)
* ğŸ‘€ [Remix PR - Support for client side `routerContext`](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/12515)
* ğŸ¦ [React Three Fiber v9 in RC, supporting React 19 and Three.js WebGPURenderer](https://x.com/0xca0a/status/1882441755368563114)
* ğŸ“œ [DexieJs: Reactive local state in React](https://www.typeonce.dev/article/dexie-js-reactive-local-state-in-react): You might not need a React state management library, the browser provides a built-in reactive IndexedDB. This great article shows how to wire everything (live queries and actions) using modern React 19 features.
* ğŸ“œ [Next.js: an honest review](https://beeps.dev/blog/nextjs-an-honest-review): An interesting and quite pragmatic list of pros/cons of using Next.js in production apps.
* ğŸ“œ [Why I Wonâ€™t Use JSDOM](https://www.epicweb.dev/why-i-won-t-use-jsdom): Recommends testing frontend components in an actual browser, using Vitest Browser Mode and Playwright, instead of a polyfilled Node.js env like JSDOM. The React integration is similar to using React Testing Library.
* ğŸ“œ [UX++ and DX++ with Sync Engines](https://www.carlassmann.com/blog/improve-ux-dx-with-sync-engines): Explains why itâ€™s difficult to invalidate queries and implement optimistic UI with React Query, then propose to use a local-first model with Replicache.
* ğŸ“œ [Moving on from React, a Year Later](https://kellysutton.com/2025/01/18/moving-on-from-react-a-year-later.html): Feedback on removing React from a server-rendered Rails application, considering JS a handicap.
* ğŸ“œ [Server-side React that renders as png, pdf, or interactive webapp](https://swizec.com/blog/server-side-react-that-renders-as-png-pdf-or-interactive-webapp/): Using a search parameter to return a PDF or png in a TanStack Start app.
* ğŸ“œ [How to handle multiple concurrent submissions in Remix](https://tigerabrodi.blog/how-to-handle-multiple-concurrent-submissions-in-remix)
* ğŸ“œ [Why are React Server Components actually beneficial?](https://tigerabrodi.blog/why-is-react-server-components-actually-beneficial-full-history)
* ğŸ“œ [Picking a state management library for a React app used by millions (and why we went with MobX)](https://www.photoroom.com/inside-photoroom/picking-a-state-management-library-why-we-went-with-mobx-)
* ğŸ“œ [useAsyncFetcher: How to implement an asynchronous fetch function in a Remix app](https://www.cerbos.dev/blog/useasyncfetcher-implement-asynchronous-fetch-in-remix)
* ğŸ“œ [Intro to Formik](https://playfulprogramming.com/posts/formik-intro)
* ğŸ“œ [How to build a CMS with React-Admin](https://marmelab.com/blog/2025/01/24/how-to-build-a-cms-with-react-admin.html)
* ğŸ“¦ [Vercel Next.js SaaS Starter](https://github.com/nextjs/saas-starter): Initially created by Lee Robinson, itâ€™s now an official package maintained by Vercel. You probably donâ€™t need to buy a paid boilerplate.
* ğŸ“¦ [2n8 - Class-based React store](https://2n8.wstone.uk/): An interesting blend between MobX and Zustand.
* ğŸ¥ [Theo - Why is every React site so slow?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=INLq9RPAYUw)
* ğŸ¥ [Youssef Benlemlih - TanStack Router Full Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fpXOT8SNTpY)

segments.content: Reactile is an UI/UX turnkey framework which features an out-of-the-box, intuitive tiling display with workspaces. It encourages parallel workloads for large web solutions within a single browser tab. Implement your own view containers, widgets and logic using React and let Reactile handle the display for you.
segments.sourceMdx: Reactile is an UI/UX turnkey framework which features an out-of-the-box, intuitive tiling display with workspaces. It encourages parallel workloads for large web solutions within a single browser tab. Implement your own view containers, widgets and logic using React and let Reactile handle the display for you.

segments.content: On top of that, Reactile also offers:
segments.sourceMdx: On top of that, Reactile also offers:

segments.content:
* A promise-based persistence mechanism which permits a uniform workflow across time and on multiple devices.
* The possibility to use nested tabs for your tiles.
* A simplified global search mechanism.
* CSS @container based responsiveness.
* And much more.
segments.sourceMdx:
- A promise-based persistence mechanism which permits a uniform workflow across time and on multiple devices.
- The possibility to use nested tabs for your tiles.
- A simplified global search mechanism.
- CSS @container based responsiveness.
- And much more.

segments.content: Version 2 coming out soon. Get started with your unique 30-day free trial. Learn more about it on reactile.net.
segments.sourceMdx: Version 2 coming out soon. Get started with your unique 30-day free trial. Learn more about it on reactile.net.

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [PostHog - How Swype uses mobile session replays for testing and user insights](https://dub.link/twir-jan29)
* ğŸ“£ [React Native 0.79 - Removal of Remote JS Debugging via Chrome](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals/discussions/872)
* ğŸ¦ [Fernando Rojo highlights â€œnewer versions of React Native have a less expensive `<Text>` componentâ€](https://x.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1882111985661415556): Starting at v0.75+ (not sure), text components with simple string children are much faster.
* ğŸ¦ [React Native at Shopify - CTOâ€™s perspective](https://x.com/jmwind/status/1882071857098080653): Former Shopify CTO shared a long tweet that completes nicely the recent Shopify blog post. The decision to adopt RN took years. They took a bet on technology and community based on potential, not on the current state.
* ğŸ¦ [iOS App Clip in Expo Router demo](https://x.com/Baconbrix/status/1882141919574360421): This runs native iOS app screens simply by clicking a link, without even installing from the App Store.
* ğŸ¦ [Multiple windows on iPadOS demo](https://x.com/o_kwasniewski/status/1882388170643272130): A new â€œReact Native Factoryâ€ feature unlocks new brownfield and multi-window possibilities.
* ğŸ“œ [How to build beautiful React Native bottom tabs](https://expo.dev/blog/how-to-build-beautiful-react-native-bottom-tabs)
* ğŸ“œ [Introducing React Native Audio API](https://blog.swmansion.com/hello-react-native-audio-api-bb0f10347211)
* ğŸ“œ [Over the Air (OTA) updates with Zephyr](https://zephyr-cloud.io/blog/ota-with-zephyr): Gives the possibility for super apps to update their submodules independently.
* ğŸ“¦ [Polygen - Run WebAssembly modules in your apps, statically, without interpreting](https://github.com/callstackincubator/polygen): This Callstack package in preview converts Wasm to C and then call it through JSI to deliver great performance.
* ğŸ“¦ [Hot Updater - A self-hostable OTA update solution for React Native](https://github.com/gronxb/hot-updater): An interesting alternative to CodePush. Plugins let you decide where to host the JS bundles (S3, Supabase, PostgreSQL).
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Windows 0.77](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-windows/releases/tag/react-native-windows_v0.77.0), and [MacOS 0.77](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-macos/pull/2333) should come soon
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native 0.74.7](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.74.7): End-of-life release, 0.74.x is now out of support.
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native CSS Animation presets for Reanimated 4](https://github.com/software-mansion-labs/react-native-css-animations)

segments.sourceMdx:

- ğŸ“£ [React Native 0.79 \- Removal of Remote JS Debugging via Chrome](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals/discussions/872)
- ğŸ¦ [Fernando Rojo highlights â€œnewer versions of React Native have a less expensive `<Text>` componentâ€](https://x.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1882111985661415556): Starting at v0.75+ (not sure), text components with simple string children are much faster.
- ğŸ¦ [React Native at Shopify \- CTOâ€™s perspective](https://x.com/jmwind/status/1882071857098080653): Former Shopify CTO shared a long tweet that completes nicely the recent Shopify blog post. The decision to adopt RN took years. They took a bet on technology and community based on potential, not on the current state.
- ğŸ¦ [iOS App Clip in Expo Router demo](https://x.com/Baconbrix/status/1882141919574360421): This runs native iOS app screens simply by clicking a link, without even installing from the App Store.
- ğŸ¦ [Multiple windows on iPadOS demo](https://x.com/o_kwasniewski/status/1882388170643272130): A new â€œReact Native Factoryâ€ feature unlocks new brownfield and multi-window possibilities.
- ğŸ“œ [How to build beautiful React Native bottom tabs](https://expo.dev/blog/how-to-build-beautiful-react-native-bottom-tabs)
- ğŸ“œ [Introducing React Native Audio API](https://blog.swmansion.com/hello-react-native-audio-api-bb0f10347211)
- ğŸ“œ [Over the Air (OTA) updates with Zephyr](https://zephyr-cloud.io/blog/ota-with-zephyr): Gives the possibility for super apps to update their submodules independently.
- ğŸ“¦ [Polygen \- Run WebAssembly modules in your apps, statically, without interpreting](https://github.com/callstackincubator/polygen): This Callstack package in preview converts Wasm to C and then call it through JSI to deliver great performance.
- ğŸ“¦ [Hot Updater \- A self-hostable OTA update solution for React Native](https://github.com/gronxb/hot-updater): An interesting alternative to CodePush. Plugins let you decide where to host the JS bundles (S3, Supabase, PostgreSQL).
- ğŸ“¦ [React Native Windows 0.77](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-windows/releases/tag/react-native-windows_v0.77.0), and [MacOS 0.77](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-macos/pull/2333) should come soon
- ğŸ“¦ [React Native 0.74.7](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.74.7): End-of-life release, 0.74.x is now out of support.
